title: Mass General Brigham ‘strongly encouraging’ masking for visitors as respiratory infections spike
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Health For the time being, MGB is requiring its health care providers to wear masks during direct patient interaction.

Paul Yeung/Bloomberg Creative Photos, Bloomberg By Abby Patkin January 2, 2026 | 4:18 PM 1 minute to read With respiratory infections on the rise in Massachusetts and flu cases spiking, the state’s largest hospital system says patients and visitors are “strongly encouraged” to wear masks during doctors appointments.

More health news: For the time being, Mass General Brigham said its health care providers will be required to wear masks during direct patient interactions, including meetings in patient rooms or other clinical care areas.

title: Man arrested after victim finds stolen skis listed on Facebook Marketplace
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Crime Officials are urging members of the public to use "Safe Exchange Zones" inside BPD stations.

title: Watch: Firefighters in R.I. rescue yellow Lab who fell through the ice
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Local News Volunteers reported arriving within minutes and locating the dog struggling in the water, unable to move.
Firefighters rescue Phoenix, a yellow Lab that fell through the ice on New Year's Day in Rhode Island.

Misquamicut Fire Department A yellow Lab named Phoenix rose from the ashes — or at least the ice — after falling into a frozen pond in Rhode Island on New Year’s Day, necessitating an ice rescue from local firefighters.
